essentials.pack.name: Essentials
essentials.datapack.description: Adds player selection and teleportation request dialogs
essentials.request.dialog.outbound.title: Your open teleport requests
essentials.request.dialog.inbound.title: Your incoming teleport requests
essentials.request.dialog.inbound.body:
Accept or Decline a request.
 A request that is accepted or declined will be deleted
essentials.teleport.here: Teleporting "%1$s" to here because they have ID: %2$s
essentials.teleport.to: Teleporting to "%1$s" because they have ID: %2$s
essentials.request.accepted.here: Teleporting to "%1$s" because they have ID: %2$s
essentials.request.accepted.to: Teleporting "%1$s" to here because they have ID: %2$s
essentials.actions.dialog.title: Select an action to use
essentials.actions.dialog.body: Perform a command with your %s score.
essentials.main.dialog.body:
These are all the data-driven json dialogs.
Many more dialogs can be accessed through these, but those are generated and displayed using macros and inline dialog definitions.
essentials.select_player.dialog.title: Select a player selection dialog
essentials.select_player.dialog.body.mes: Both these dialogs are created inline with the use of macros and command storage.
The pretty dialog creates a button per player/entity, this is a lot more user friendly.
It is not possible to open either of these dialogs directly, to create them a trigger command is required.
essentials.request.invalid: Found an invalid request and deleted it! Removed: %s
essentials.request.dialog.create.title: Send Teleport Request
essentials.request.dialog.create.body: Send a player a request to teleport to them or teleport them here (to you)
essentials.demo.dialog.title: Demo functions
essentials.demo.dialog.body: These actions require you to be server operator
essentials.demo.dialog.actions.remove_fa: Does not reset %s counter, that would require a manual reset.
essentials.demo.dialog.actions.fake_requ: These fake requests are only for %s 1
essentials.demo.cleanup.warning: Cleaned up all fake players that were loaded. Warning! The %s score now has a gap! Any fake players in unloaded chunks remain.
essentials.demo.fake_players.dupe.warnin: Fake players have already been spawned!
essentials.demo.fake_request:
Example requests have been created, these examples still rely on actual entities with a %s score to resolve their labels.
The fake player demo function can be used to ensure entities with these scores exist to be resolved.
essentials.help.dialog.trigger.descripti: This dialog can also be accessed using the trigger command:
essentials.help.dialog.singleoption.func: You can test the singleoption player selection dialog using:
You can select a player with buttons for each player using:
essentials.help.dialog.request.create.de: You can create teleport to/here requests using:
essentials.help.dialog.request.inbound.d: You can accept and decline teleport requests using:
You can remove your own teleport requests using:
essentials.requests.dialog.title: Create, view and accept requests
essentials.requests.dialog.body: These dialogs handle the creation, execution and deletion of teleport requests
essentials.requests.dialog.actions.creat: This dialog allows you to create teleport requests that require approval of the target player
essentials.admin.dialog.title: Admin functions
essentials.admin.dialog.body: These actions require you to be server operator
essentials.player_selection.dialog.title: Select a player
